# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `mi_ha`
* Variable label: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Variable description: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack since the last wave`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No
1        | Yes

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "Myocardial infarction or heart attack"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
yes_vector <- c('Yes, diagnosed, never hospitalised','Yes, diagnosed & hospitalised','Yes diagnosed and hospitalized','Yes diagnosed, not hospitalized')
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process




## Poland

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `h10a` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Diagnosed/hospitalised for heart attack/acute myocardial infarction`|
| **Table name**  | `Po_baseline_etic`|
| **Categories** |`Yes, diagnosed, never hospitalised`<br/>`Yes, diagnosed & hospitalised`<br/>`No or do not know` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign pol_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HAPIEE_pol_w1','HAPIEE.Po_baseline_etic',variables=list('h10a'), missings = T)
HAPIEE_pol_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'HAPIEE_pol_w1')

```

```{r local pol_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w1$h10a
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HAPIEE_pol_w1, aes(x=factor(h10a))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency") + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=5))

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `No or do not know into 0`
* `Yes into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo pol_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1 <- tibble(id=HAPIEE_pol_w1$id)
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$mi_ha <- car::recode(HAPIEE_pol_w1$h10a, "'No or do not know'=0; yes_vector=1; NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript pol_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$mi_ha
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1, aes(x=factor(mi_ha))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation pol_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$mi_ha, useNA = "ifany")
X <- table(HAPIEE_pol_w1$h10a, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- c(X[1],sum(X[2:3]),X[4])
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("No->0","Yes->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(HAPIEE_pol_w1)

```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable by cohort:

**R script:**

```{r summ}

lb.hds <- list(pol_w1 = HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1, cz_w1 = HAPIEE_ds_cz_w1)
#lf.hds <- list(pol_w2 = HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2, cz_w2 = HAPIEE_ds_cz_w2)

for(name in names(lb.hds)) {
  aux_object <- lb.hds[[name]]
  label(lb.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lb.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(lb.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("HAPIEE_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}
```
